results.name: Adhemar Ferreira da Silva
results.bio: Adhemar Ferreira da Silva was a Brazilian athlete, winner of two Olympic gold medals and five world records in the triple jump.

results.name: Agatha Christie
results.bio: Agatha Christie was an English detective novelist and playwright whose books have sold more than 100 million copies and have been translated into some 100 languages.

results.name: Alfred Theophil Holder
results.bio: Alfred Theophil Holder was an Austrian-born language scholar of astonishing productivity in classical and medieval Latin, Germanic, and Celtic studies who produced the monumental Altceltischer Sprachschatz,.

results.name: Andrey Sergeyevich Bubnov
results.bio: Andrey Sergeyevich Bubnov was a Bolshevik revolutionary and Communist Party and Soviet government official who became a prominent education official.

results.name: André Morellet
results.bio: André Morellet was a French economist and miscellaneous writer, an associate of the Philosophes and a contributor to the Encyclopédie.

results.name: Bass Reeves
results.bio: Bass Reeves was an American lawman who was one of the first deputy U.

results.name: Bob Kaufman
results.bio: Bob Kaufman was an innovative African-American poet who became an important figure of the Beat movement.

results.name: Charles B. Huggins
results.bio: Charles B.

results.name: Charles Emmanuel Grace
results.bio: Charles Emmanuel Grace was an African American revivalist and founder of the United House of Prayer for All People.

results.name: Cyrus Vance
results.bio: Cyrus Vance was an American lawyer and public official who was secretary of state from 1977 to 1980 during the administration of U.

results.name: Daniello Bartoli
results.bio: Daniello Bartoli was a Jesuit historian and humanist who ranked among classic Italian writers.

results.name: Einar Benediktsson
results.bio: Einar Benediktsson was a Neoromantic poet called by some the greatest Icelandic poet of the 20th century.

results.name: Ellen Arthur
results.bio: Ellen Arthur was the wife of Chester A.

results.name: Ernst Hasse
results.bio: Ernst Hasse was a German nationalist and political leader who turned the General German League (Allgemeiner Deutscher Verband), founded in 1891, into the militantly nationalistic and anti-Semitic Pan-German.

results.name: Finn Ronne
results.bio: Finn Ronne was a Norwegian-born American explorer and writer who visited Antarctica nine times, discovering and charting vast areas of the 4,000,000-square-mile (10,400,000-square-kilometre) continent.

results.name: Francisco Ribalta
results.bio: Francisco Ribalta was a Spanish painter who was one of the first artists to be influenced by the new realism initiated by Caravaggio in Italy.

results.name: François Bigot
results.bio: François Bigot was a French civil servant, lawyer, and the last intendant of New France (1748–60), whose corrupt administration aided the British conquest of Canada.

results.name: Friedrich von Schlegel
results.bio: Friedrich von Schlegel was a German writer and critic, originator of many of the philosophical ideas that inspired the early German Romantic movement.

results.name: Georg Forster
results.bio: Georg Forster was an explorer and scientist who helped to establish the literary travel book as a favoured genre in German literature.

results.name: Georg Jellinek
results.bio: Georg Jellinek was a German legal and political philosopher who, in his book Die sozialethische Bedeutung von Recht, Unrecht und Strafe (1878; 2nd ed.
